hello erik.

On 2012-08-30 12:51 , Erik Mogensen wrote:
> tl;dr: Use OpenSearch.

OpenSearch is nice and a good starting point, but unfortunately it is 
kind of in limbo (everything is undated, some parts are in draft 
status), and the extension model to add some stuff yourself is 
underspecified. and then it's outdated in various ways, for example it 
defines its own URI template format, which by now you really would want 
to substitute with the standardized form.

so while there is useful stuff in OpenSearch and it's implemented in 
various places, it's poorly maintained and i still hope that a9 or 
amazon will fix that at some point in time. we are also considering 
using it, in spite of these issues, but for those looking at it, it's 
important to know that there are some concerns about the spec.

cheers,

dret.
